contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "I also remember your" or "I also recall your" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: I have been reminded of your

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God chose me to be a preacher" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "for the people whom God has chosen" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

"All scripture is God-breathed." This means God produced the scripture through his Spirit by telling people what to write. This can be stated in active form. AT: "God has spoken all the scriptures by his Spirit" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: All scripture has been inspired by God

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "May God not count it against them" or "I pray that God does not punish those believers for leaving me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: May it not be counted against them
